Utterance: Hi there! It’s good to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing okay. I actually signed up for that painting class!
That’s fantastic news! How was your first class?
It was really fun! I met some nice people, and I enjoyed painting.
That’s wonderful to hear! Making connections while doing something you love is so important.
Yes, and it felt good to express myself creatively.
I’m glad you found that outlet. Have you been able to practice any mindfulness or breathing exercises since we last spoke?
Yes! I’ve been doing them before bed, and it’s helped me sleep better.
That’s great progress! How has your sleep been since then?
I’d say it’s improved to about 75% of the time I sleep well now.
That’s a significant improvement! What do you think contributed to that change?
I think the combination of reading, breathing exercises, and not using my phone before bed has helped.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re really taking charge of your well-being. Have you had a chance to talk to your daughters about your worries?
Yes, I did! I opened up to them, and it felt really good.
That’s wonderful to hear! How did they respond?
They were really understanding. It made me feel closer to them.
That’s so important for your relationship. It’s great that you took that step.
Thank you! I feel like I’m making progress.
You absolutely are! Are there any other areas in your life where you’d like to focus on or improve?
I think I’d like to work on my social skills a bit more.
That’s a great goal. What specific aspects of social interaction would you like to improve?
Maybe feeling more confident in starting conversations with new people.
Building confidence in social situations can be very beneficial. Would you like to practice some conversational skills here?
Yes, that would help!
Great! Let’s role-play a scenario where you meet someone new at the painting class. How would you start a conversation?
Um, I guess I could say something like, “Hi, what do you think of the class so far?”
That’s a good opener! It’s friendly and inviting. How do you think the other person might respond?
They might say they’re enjoying it or ask me what I like to paint.
Exactly! And that opens the door for further conversation. Would you like to try another scenario?
Sure!
Let’s say you’re at a coffee shop. How would you approach someone sitting alone?
I could say, “Hi, is this seat taken?”
Perfect! That’s a simple and effective way to start. How does practicing these scenarios make you feel?
A little nervous, but I think it’s helpful to think about it.
It’s completely normal to feel nervous. The more you practice, the easier it will become.
I hope so!
Would you like to set a goal to try starting a conversation with someone new this week?
Yes, I’ll try to do that!
Excellent! Remember to be kind to yourself, regardless of the outcome.
I will.
Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think that covers it for now.
Great! I’m proud of the progress you’re making. Let’s check in again next week on your goals and experiences.
Thank you, Ellie!
Take care, and I look forward to hearing all about it!
Bye!
Goodbye!
